newsitem.title: USA: BEFORE THE BELL - Glenayre off sharply.
newsitem.headline: BEFORE THE BELL - Glenayre off sharply.

text.p: Shares in Glenayre Technologies Inc fell to 22 from 33-1/4 preceding Monday's U.S. market on selling sparked by the company's warning about quarterly results and a subsequent analyst downgrade.

After Friday's market close, the company said it expected third quarter net income to be 40 to 50 percent below the same quarter last year because of lack of short-term shippable orders, sales mix and expensess would hurt earnings.
Both sales and earnings would be well below Wall Street third quarter estimates, Glenayre said.
Also, Merrill Lynch cut the stock's near-term rating to neutral from accumulate and lowered the long-term rating to accumulate from buy.
Elsewhere, Citizens Bancorp shares were bid at 47-5/8, 15-3/8 above Friday's Nasdaq close, after it announced a $774 million stock-swap merger agreement with Crestar Financial Corp.
Citizens' holders will receive 0.835 shares of Crestar for each share of Citizens stock they hold, the banks said.
Based on Crestar's $61.375 per share Friday closing price, the deal is worth $51.25 per Citizens share, they said.

Shares in Nike Inc started to move higher preceding the market open after the company reported fiscal first quarter earnings of $1.53 per share, $0.02 above the First Call consensus forecast and better than the $1.25 per share netted in the year-ago period.
The shares were trading at 120, up 3/4 from Friday's New York Stock Exchange close, according to Instinet.
Also, traders reported no moves in Ohio Edison Co or Centerior Energy Corp after the utilities said they agreed to merge to create a new company with an equity value of $4.8 billion.
Friday, Ohio Edison closed at 20-7/8, and Centerior closed at 7-5/8.
